meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Here's my review of Kona: Day One Edition!

As I delved into this mystery-solving adventure game, I couldn't help but think of the old saying: "You can't judge a book by its cover"... or in this case, you can't judge a detective by their mustache. Yes, our protagonist, Carl Kolchak, has an impressive 'stache that's almost as thick as his Scottish brogue.

Now, on to the good stuff! Kona is all about exploring the small town of Fournier, uncovering secrets, and solving puzzles. It's like a cozy whodunit novel come to life, minus the pesky plot holes (I'm looking at you, Eurogamer Italy - Quotation forthcoming? Come on, guys!). The game's atmosphere is thick with suspense, much like my aunt's gossiping circle.

Let me get this straight: Vandal thinks Kona relies too heavily on its narrative and doesn't offer anything special gameplay-wise. Okay, fine. I get it. Some folks might find the exploration and story-telling a bit repetitive. But hey, if you're like me - someone who loves a good mystery - you'll be hooked! SpazioGames enjoyed their time with Kona, even with some technical hiccups and a less-than-satisfying finale (looking at you, TheSixthAxis!).

COGconnected praises the game's captivating narrative and stellar graphics. And, GameCritics, you're absolutely right; it does fill that nosy friend niche nicely! Who doesn't love snoopin' around someone else's house? Even God is a Geek thought it was an intriguing mystery to solve in an interesting setting!

Now, don't get me wrong - Kona's not perfect. The survival and combat elements can feel a bit... forced. And, yeah, the backtracking might drive you a wee bit mad (I'm looking at you, SpazioGames!). But hey, that's part of the fun, right?

All in all, if you're in the mood for a good mystery game with some exploration and story-telling thrown in, Kona: Day One Edition is worth a look. Hippo Penny out!
